unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why You Should Hit Up a Film Fest
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why You Should Hit Up a Film Fest

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been catching up on any good cinema lately? If you're anything like me, you're always on the hunt for the next amazing movie. And let me tell you, there's a goldmine of cinematic gems waiting to be discovered – at film festivals!
normalised: Hey everyone! Been catching up on any good cinema lately? If you're anything like me, you're always on the hunt for the next amazing movie. And let me tell you, there's a goldmine of cinematic gems waiting to be discovered – at film festivals!

unnormalised: Forget the same old Bollywood blockbusters (though, let's be honest, sometimes a good DDLJ re-watch is all we need!). Film festivals are your passport to a world of independent films, documentaries, shorts, and experimental works you won’t find anywhere else. Think of it as a curated buffet of visual storytelling, often with q&a sessions with directors.
normalised: Forget the same old Bollywood blockbusters (though, let's be honest, sometimes a good D D L J re-watch is all we need!). Film festivals are your passport to a world of independent films, documentaries, shorts, and experimental works you won’t find anywhere else. Think of it as a curated buffet of visual storytelling, often with Q and A sessions with directors.

unnormalised: Take the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI), for example. Every year, they bring in a stunning array of international and Indian films. Seeing a movie there, surrounded by fellow cinephiles and maybe even bumping into Anurag Kashyap in the lobby, is an experience in itself.
normalised: Take the Mumbai Film Festival (M A M I), for example. Every year, they bring in a stunning array of international and Indian films. Seeing a movie there, surrounded by fellow cinephiles and maybe even bumping into Anurag Kashyap in the lobby, is an experience in itself.

unnormalised: But film festivals are more than just screenings. They're a community. You can connect with filmmakers, actors, and other enthusiasts, sparking conversations and expanding your understanding of the art form. They also often host workshops and seminars. I remember attending one on screenplay writing at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa years ago, and it was incredibly insightful.

unnormalised: Plus, let's be real, festivals are often held in cool locations. Imagine watching a film under the stars in Rajasthan or attending a panel discussion in a heritage building in Kolkata. It’s a mini vacation combined with a serious dose of culture.
normalised: Plus, let's be real, festivals are often held in cool locations. Imagine watching a film under the stars in Rajasthan or attending a panel discussion in a heritage building in Kolkata. It’s a mini vacation combined with a serious dose of culture.

unnormalised: So, whether you're a seasoned film buff or just curious to explore something new, check out the festival calendar. You might just discover your next favourite film, and maybe even a new perspective on the world. The Jaipur International Film Festival, or even smaller, local ones held in places like Pune, can be really exciting. Tickets usually range from Rs. 200-Rs. 500, sometimes even free, and the experiences are priceless. The next festival might be closer than you think! Start searching within a 50 km radius!
